channel.title: New Source Review (NSR) Permitting
channel.description: Updated New Source Review (NSR) Permitting content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: John Deere Dubuque Works Stationary or Mobile Source Determination
item.description:
This document may be of assistance in applying the New Source Review (NSR) and Title V air permitting regulations including the Prevention of Significant Deterioration (PSD) requirements. This document is part of the NSR Policy and Guidance Database and Title V Policy and Guidance Database. Some documents in the database are a scanned or retyped version of a paper photocopy of the original. Although we have taken considerable effort to quality assure the documents, some may contain typographical errors. Contact the office that issued the document if you need a copy of the original.

  • John Deere Dubuque Works, Mobile or Stationary Source Emissions (PDF)(3 pp, 2 MB, 2016-11-10)
item.dc:creator: jknodel

item.title: Rescission of Preconstruction Permits Issued Under the Clean Air Act: Final Rule
item.description:
This final rule amends the Federal Prevention of Significant Deterioration (PSD) rules to remove a date restriction that limited the use of a provision allowing a PSD permit to be cancelled.  Before this revision, only permits based on rules issued on or before July 30, 1987 and any PSD greenhouse gas permits issued as part of Step 2 of the Tailoring Rule could be rescinded.

  • Rescission of Preconstruction Permits Issued Under the Clean Air Act - Final Rule (PDF) (6 pp, 215 K, About PDF) - Federal Register - November 7, 2016
  • Fact Sheet: Final Rule Allowing Rescission of Preconstruction Permits Issued under the Clean Air Act (PDF)(2 pp, 84 K)
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Clean Air Act Permitting Electronic Notice Final Rule
item.description:
October 5, 2016 - EPA is issuing a final rule revising its public notice regulations for the New Source Review, title V and Outer Continental Shelf permit programs of the Clean Air Act. This action removes the mandatory requirement to provide public notice for draft permits (and certain other program actions) by newspaper publication and instead provides for electronic-notice (e-notice) of these actions. Permitting authorities that implement e-notice also are required to post the draft permit on a website (e-access).  

This page includes a link to the Federal Register notice and a summary fact sheet.

  • Final Rule  - Federal Register, October 18, 2016
  • Fact Sheet: Revisions to the Public Notice Provisions in Clean Air Act Permitting Programs (PDF)(2 pp, 32 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: United States - Canada Air Quality Agreement Notification Table
item.description:
The list below provides Clean Air Act permitting information, beginning in January 2015, for facilities near the US-Canada border.

Find older permitting information in EPA's archive. Search EPA Archive (search term: AQA Notification)

  • Lordstown Energy Center, Lordstown, OH, 07/21/2015 (PDF)(4 pp, 76 K)
  • DET Gas Company, Milford Compressor Station, Milford, MI, 12/03/2015 (PDF)(2 pp, 58 K)
  • Dearborn Industrial Generation, LLC, Dearborn, MI, 02/29/2016 (PDF)(2 pp, 59 K)
item.dc:creator: aingram

item.title: Prevention of Significant Deterioration and Title V Permitting Regulations for Greenhouse Gases (GHG) and Establishment of a GHG Significant Emissions Rate Documents
item.description:
On August 26, 2016, the EPA proposed a set of common sense changes needed to bring EPA’s air permitting regulations in line with Supreme Court and D.C. Circuit decisions on greenhouse gas permitting. This rulemaking proposes revisions to existing PSD and title V regulations to ensure that neither the PSD nor title V rules require a source to obtain a permit solely because the source emits or has the potential to emit GHGs above the applicable thresholds.

  • Proposed Revisions to the Prevention of Significant Deterioration and Title V Permitting Regulations for Greenhouse Gases (GHG) and Establishment of a GHG Significant Emissions Rate (PDF)(38 pp, 457 K, About PDF) - Federal Register - October 3, 2016
  • Extention of the Comment Period(2 pp, 236 K, About PDF) - Federal Register - November 18, 2016
  • Proposed Revisions to the Prevention of Significant Deterioration and Title V Permitting Regulations for Greenhouse Gases (GHG) and Establishment of a GHG Significant Emissions Rate: Fact Sheet (PDF)(4 pp, 57 K)
  • Slides from September 20, 2016 Webinar (PDF)(24 pp, 136 K, Sept 20, 2016)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Webinar on Draft SILS Guidance August 24, 2016
item.description:
A webinar on the draft SILs guidance was held on Wednesday, August 24th, 2016. The slides from the presentation are available below, along with the draft guidance.

  • Webinar Presentation Slides - Draft SILS Guidance (PDF)(18 pp, 397 K, August 2016)
  • Draft Guidance on Significant Impact Levels (SILs) for Ozone and Fine Particles in the Prevention of Significant Deterioration Permitting Program (PDF)(84 pp, 3 MB, July 2016)
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Draft Guidance for Comment: Significant Impact Levels for Ozone and Fine Particle in the Prevention of Significant Deterioration Permitting Program
item.description:
EPA is providing an important opportunity for interested stakeholders to review the draft guidance and supporting documents recommending Significant Impact levels (SILs) for ozone and fine particle pollution that may be used in the Prevention of Significant Deterioration (PSD) permitting program.  SILs have been used in the PSD permitting process for many years to help determine whether proposed construction may be authorized in a Clean Air Act permit. EPA will accept public comment on the draft guidance and supporting documents through September 30, 2016.

  • Legal Support Memorandum Application of Significant Impact Levels in the Air Quality Demonstration for Prevention of Significant Deterioration Permitting under the Clean Air Act for Public Review (PDF)(10 pp, 82 K, August 1, 2016)
  • Technical Basis for the EPA's Development of Significant Impact Levels for PM2.5 and Ozone, Appendices (PDF)(200 pp, 24 MB, August 1, 2016)
  • Draft Guidance on Significant Impact Levels for Ozone and Fine Particles in the Prevention of Significant Deterioration Permitting Program (PDF)(14 pp, 422 K, August 18, 2016)
  • Technical Basis for the EPA’s Development of Significant Impact Thresholds for PM2.5 and Ozone (PDF)(52 pp, 2 MB, August 1, 2016)
item.dc:creator: jcortely
